New Records: Kyle Higashioka became the first Padres catcher to homer in consecutive playoff games.
The sellout crowd of 47,705 was the largest in Petco Park history.
Key Match Events: Kyle Higashioka’s solo homer started a five-run rally against Max Fried with two outs in the second inning.
Manny Machado added a two-run double with the bases loaded.
Jackson Merrill followed with a two-run triple.
Robert Suarez pitched a perfect ninth for the save.
Jorge Soler hit a solo homer in the fifth inning.
Michael Harris II had a two-run shot in the eighth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Kyle Higashioka said, 'This team’s always shown the ability to be resilient and never quit.'
Braves manager Brian Snitker said, 'I’m about as proud of a team as I’ve ever had.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Max Fried and Joe Musgrove exited early with injuries.
The Padres will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the National League Division Series.
